intro: Teucrium betonicum, commonly known as heartworts, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. The genus Teucrium is part of the Lamiaceae family, known for its aromatic properties and medicinal uses.
